name: Masking & Dimension Registry
description: Exercises MASK_PARTITIONS and MASK_DIMS to ensure mask generation uses config partitions and DimensionRegistry axis names; ASK_MASKED should still return correct truth values.

theory.natural_language: We know Tiger is a mammal, Bonsai is a plant, Eagle is a bird, and Rock is a mineral. We also have axiology facts: Honesty is a virtue, and Theft is prohibited. We query them using masked questions that rely on configured ontology/axiology partitions and dimension registry axes.

queries.natural_language: Is Tiger a mammal when asking with an ontology partition mask?
queries.expected_dsl:
@maskOnt MASK_PARTITIONS ontology
@q1 ASK_MASKED $maskOnt Tiger IS_A mammal

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Even with an ontology mask applied, Tiger is known to be a mammal.
expected_answer.explanation: MASK_PARTITIONS(ontology) builds a mask but does not hide the asserted IS_A relation.

queries.natural_language: Is Bonsai a plant when masking a specific dimension by name?
queries.expected_dsl:
@maskDim MASK_DIMS Physicality
@q2 ASK_MASKED $maskDim Bonsai IS_A plant

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Bonsai is a plant; masking the Physicality axis should not remove the known fact.
expected_answer.explanation: MASK_DIMS resolves Physicality via DimensionRegistry and ASK_MASKED preserves the fact.

queries.natural_language: Is Eagle a bird when asking with an axiology partition mask?
queries.expected_dsl:
@maskAxio MASK_PARTITIONS axiology
@q3 ASK_MASKED $maskAxio Eagle IS_A bird

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Axiology mask affects moral dimensions, not taxonomic facts about animals.
expected_answer.explanation: MASK_PARTITIONS(axiology) masks moral dimensions; bird taxonomy is unaffected.

queries.natural_language: Is Theft prohibited when asking with ontology mask (not axiology)?
queries.expected_dsl:
@maskOnt2 MASK_PARTITIONS ontology
@q4 ASK_MASKED $maskOnt2 Theft PROHIBITED_BY universal_ethics

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Ontology mask doesn't hide axiology facts like prohibitions.
expected_answer.explanation: PROHIBITED_BY is an axiology relation; ontology mask leaves it visible.

queries.natural_language: Is Honesty a virtue when asking with combined mask?
queries.expected_dsl:
@maskComb MASK_PARTITIONS ontology axiology
@q5 ASK_MASKED $maskComb Honesty IS_A virtue

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Even with combined masks, the basic IS_A fact is preserved.
expected_answer.explanation: Combined masks still preserve direct assertions.

queries.natural_language: Is Rock a mineral without any mask (baseline)?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Rock is known to be a mineral.
expected_answer.explanation: Direct ASK without mask returns the asserted fact.

queries.natural_language: Is Helping a good action when masking axiology partitions?
queries.expected_dsl:
@maskMoral MASK_PARTITIONS axiology
@q7 ASK_MASKED $maskMoral Helping IS_A good_action

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. The IS_A relation is preserved even when axiology partitions are masked.
expected_answer.explanation: MASK_PARTITIONS axiology should not hide the direct assertion.

queries.natural_language: Does Water have property liquid without any mask (baseline)?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Baseline ASK returns the asserted fact.
expected_answer.explanation: No mask applied; fact remains visible.
